intro: Lesquerella arctica, commonly known as Arctic lesquerella, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic regions of North America and Eurasia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard plants, and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to cold, harsh environments. Lesquerella arctica produces capsule fruits that contain seeds used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Its unique botanical features make it an important species for studying plant adaptation to extreme climates.
